item.title: General Catalyst commits $5B to India over five years
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The pledge marks a sharp jump from General Catalyst's earlier $500 million–$1 billion India earmark.

item.title: Ali Partovi’s Neo looks to upend the accelerator model with low-dilution terms
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Neo's new Residency program invests $750,000 in an uncapped SAFE for startups and provides a $40,000 no-strings-attached grant for college students.

item.title: Nvidia deepens early-stage push into India’s AI startup ecosystem
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Nvidia is working with investors, nonprofits, and venture firms to build earlier ties with India's fast-growing AI founder ecosystem.

item.title: Second and last chance for innovators to win scaling perks: Belden extends nomination window
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Last day to nominate for the 2026 Joseph C. Belden Innovation Award has been extended through February 27. Don't miss your chance to win scaling perks.

item.title: Why these startup CEOs don’t think AI will replace human roles
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The CEOs of Read AI and Lucidya told TechCrunch at Web Summit Qatar that they see AI tools replacing tasks, rather than workers.

item.title: Reload wants to give your AI agents a shared memory
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Reload announces a $2.275 million raise in a round led by Anthemis and the launch of its first AI employee, Epic.

item.title: Co-founders behind Reface and Prisma join hands to improve on-device model inference with Mirai
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Mirai raised a $10 million seed round to improve how AI models run on devices like smartphones and laptops.

item.title: Freeform raises $67M Series B to scale up laser AI manufacturing
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: “I think we're the only quote-unquote manufacturing company out there that has H200 clusters in a data center on site."

item.title: This VC’s best advice for building a founding team
item.dc:creator: Maggie Nye
item.description: One of the most consequential decisions early-stage founders have to make is who they will bring on as their founding team. That’s why this season on Build Mode, we’re diving into what it takes to build a world-class founding team.

item.title: Is your startup’s check engine light on? Google Cloud’s VP explains what to do
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Startup founders are being pushed to move faster than ever, using AI while facing tighter funding, rising infrastructure costs, and more pressure to show real traction early. Cloud credits, access to GPUs, and foundation models have made it easier to get started, but those early infrastructure choices can have unforeseen consequences once startups move beyond […]

item.title: A startup called Germ becomes the first private messenger that launches directly from Bluesky’s app
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Social network Bluesky now offers private messaging by integrating the startup Germ's E2E encrypted messenger natively in its app.

item.title: Google Cloud’s VP for startups on reading your ‘check engine light’ before it’s too late
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Startup founders are being pushed to move faster than ever, using AI while facing tighter funding, rising infrastructure costs, and more pressure to show real traction early. Cloud credits, access to GPUs, and foundation models have made it easier to get started, but those early infrastructure choices can have unforeseen consequences once startups move beyond […]

item.title: Kana emerges from stealth with $15M to build flexible AI agents for marketers
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Kana, a new AI marketing startup from the founders of Rapt and Krux, has raised $15 million to build customizable, agent-based marketing tools.

item.title: Mistral AI buys Koyeb in first acquisition to back its cloud ambitions
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Mistral AI has agreed to buy Koyeb, a Paris-based startup that simplifies AI app deployment at scale and manages the infrastructure behind it.

item.title: SpaceX vets raise $50M Series A for data center links
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: Mesh aims to mass-produce optical transceivers for AI data centers.

item.title: Just 8 months in, India’s vibe-coding startup Emergent claims ARR of over $100M
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh, Ivan Mehta
item.description: Indian vibe-coding platform Emergent was launched just eight months ago, and it now says it's generating annual recurring revenue of more than $100 million, thanks to surging demand by small businesses and non-technical users.

item.title: SpendRule raises $2M, emerges from stealth to help hospitals track spending
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: SpendRule, launched last summer, is an AI-powered platform that helps healthcare systems track their spending.

item.title: African defense tech Terra Industries, founded by two Gen Zers, raises additional $22M in a month
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Terra Industries, the African defense company, announced Monday that it had secured an additional $22 million in funding to further expand the business.
